intro: Pepinia fulgens, commonly known as the golden peacock orchid, is a striking member of the orchid family native to the tropical regions of South America. This plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers, which resemble the plumage of a peacock, hence its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. The plant produces showy, pendulous blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a valuable species in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
